agentGuidance.overview: This catalog contains instruction sets, prompts, and skills for various development tasks. Use this guidance to select the most appropriate resources for user projects based on their requirements, technologies, and context.

matchingExamples.userQuery: I need to install a new npm package for my React project
matchingExamples.reasoning: Query mentions npm package installation, which directly matches the npm instruction set focused on package management

matchingExamples.userQuery: How should I structure my new React component?
matchingExamples.reasoning: Query is about React component development standards, matching the another instruction set which covers React component standards

matchingExamples.userQuery: I need to set up a new JavaScript project with dependencies
matchingExamples.reasoning: Query involves JavaScript project setup and dependencies, matching npm instruction set for package management

prioritizationRules: Prioritize instructions with exact tag matches to user technologies
Prefer comprehensive instruction sets over specialized ones for broad queries
Consider instruction recency and community adoption
Factor in user's stated expertise level - provide more detailed guidance for beginners
agentGuidance.combinationGuidelines: When multiple instruction sets apply, combine them in order of relevance. For example, for a React project setup you might use npm instructions first for package management, then React component instructions for development standards.
fallbackStrategies: If no exact matches found, look for instructions with related tags (e.g., 'javascript' for 'typescript' queries)
Consider general best practices instructions when specific ones don't exist
Ask user for clarification on project type or technologies if matches are unclear
Suggest creating new instruction sets for uncovered use cases

meta.description: Package management standards and security practices
meta.author: John Smith

meta.description: Guidelines for implementing structured logging using the Winston library
meta.author: John Smith
